{"step_by_step_thinking": "Sickle cell disease is caused by a mutation in the beta-globin chain of the hemoglobin molecule. This mutation is a single nucleotide change, where the 20th nucleotide of the gene for the beta chain of hemoglobin is altered from the codon GAG to GTG. This type of mutation, where a single nucleotide is changed, is known as a point mutation.", "answer_choice": "A"}
